en.sc1: Let's apply the idea of recursion to the height() method.
en.sc2: In our public method, all we have to do is recursively call the private height() helper method on the root node.
en.sc3: In our helper method, our base case is when the current node is null. If so, we return 0 because an empty node has a height of 0.
en.sc4: Otherwise, we recursively call the height() method on the left and right children of the current node.
en.sc5: We use Math.max to find the height of the taller subtree between left and right, which are determined by the recursive calls.
en.sc6: Finally, we return the height of the taller subtree plus 1 for the current node.
